bibl.title: Augustus as 'Theos' in Contemporary Papyri.
bibl.note: Draws the attention to (1) the possible use as a dating criterion of the distinction between Kaisar theos and theos Kaisar, (2) the significance of the definite article in these titulatures, and (3) the fact that the mere appearance of theos as a title can give us one clue immediately what type of document we are dealing with.

bibl.title: Proceedings of the XIXth International Congress of Papyrology. II

bibl.seg: WHITEHORNE John, Augustus as 'Theos' in Contemporary Papyri.
Proceedings of the XIXth International Congress of Papyrology. II (Cairo, 1992) pp. 421-434.

Draws the attention to (1) the possible use as a dating criterion of the distinction between Kaisar theos and theos Kaisar, (2) the significance of the definite article in these titulatures, and (3) the fact that the mere appearance of theos as a title can give us one clue immediately what type of document we are dealing with.
